soc.game

Class SOCPlayingPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.game.SOCPlayingPiece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SOCCity, SOCFortress, SOCRoutePiece, SOCSettlement, SOCVillage

    public abstract class SOCPlayingPiece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Playing pieces for Settlers of Catan. For the resources needed to build a piece type, see getResourcesToBuild(int). See also soc.robot.SOCPossiblePiece.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • ROAD

        public static final int ROAD
        Types of playing pieces: Road.
        See Also:
        getResourcesToBuild(int), Constant Field Values

      • SETTLEMENT

        public static final int SETTLEMENT
        Types of playing pieces: Settlement.
        See Also:
        getResourcesToBuild(int), Constant Field Values

      • CITY

        public static final int CITY
        Types of playing pieces: City.
        See Also:
        getResourcesToBuild(int), Constant Field Values

      • SHIP

        public static final int SHIP
        Types of playing pieces: Ship. Used only when SOCGame.hasSeaBoard. Requires client and server version 2.0.00 or newer.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        getResourcesToBuild(int), Constant Field Values

      • FORTRESS

        public static final int FORTRESS
        Types of playing pieces: Fortress. Used only when SOCGame.hasSeaBoard and scenario option _SC_PIRI. Requires client and server version 2.0.00 or newer. New fortresses cannot be built after the game starts.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VILLAGE

        public static final int VILLAGE
        Types of playing pieces: Village. Used only when SOCGame.hasSeaBoard. Requires client and server version 2.0.00 or newer. Villages belong to the game board, not to any player, and new villages cannot be built after the game starts.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MIN

        public static final int MIN
        Minimum type number of playing piece (currently Road).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAXPLUSONE

        public static final int MAXPLUSONE
        One past the maximum type number of playing piece. MAXPLUSONE == 3 up through all v1.x.xx versions. MAXPLUSONE == 6 in v2.x.xx so far.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • pieceType

        protected int pieceType
        The type of this playing piece, within range MIN to (MAXPLUSONE - 1)

      • player

        protected transient SOCPlayer player
        The player who owns this piece, if any. Will be null for certain piece types such as SOCVillage which belong to the board and not to players. Player is from same game as board.

      • coord

        protected int coord
        Coordinates on the board for this piece. An edge or a node, depending on piece type.

      • board

        protected transient SOCBoard board
        Board, for coordinate-related operations. Should be from same game as player.
        Since:
        1.1.08

      • specialVP

        public int specialVP
        Special Victory Points (SVP) awarded for placing this piece, if any. Used with the large sea board game scenarios. When specialVP != 0, the source is specialVPEvent.

        When setting or incrementing this field, should also increment/add to player's specialVP field. Don't just increase player's SVP by the piece's new specialVP, because piece may have accumulated SVP from multiple events which are already part of player's SVP amount.

        Note: This is set when the piece was placed, so it's always accurate at server. At client it may be 0 if the client joined the game after this piece was placed.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • specialVPEvent

        transient SOCPlayerEvent specialVPEvent
        If specialVP != 0, the event for which the SVP was awarded. Otherwise null.

        Note: This is set when the piece was placed, so it's always accurate at server. At client it may be null if the client joined the game after this piece was placed.

        Package access for SOCPlayer's benefit.

        Since:
        2.0.00

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCPlayingPiece

        protected SOCPlayingPiece(int ptype,
                          SOCPlayer pl,
                          int co,
                          SOCBoard pboard)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Make a new piece, which is owned by a player.
        Parameters:
        ptype - the type of piece, such as SETTLEMENT
        pl - player who owns the piece
        co - coordinates
        pboard - board if known; otherwise will extract from pl. Board should be from same game as pl.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pl null, or board null and pl.board also null
        Since:
        1.1.08
        See Also:
        SOCPlayingPiece(int, int, SOCBoard)

      • getAdjacentEdges

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getAdjacentEdges()
        Which edges touch this piece's node on the board? Should not be called for roads, because they aren't placed at a node.
        Returns:
        edges touching this piece, same format as SOCBoard.getAdjacentEdgesToNode(int)

        public int getType()
        Returns:
        the type of piece, such as ROAD

      • getPlayer

        public SOCPlayer getPlayer()
                    throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Get the player who owns this piece, if any. Certain piece types such as SOCVillage belong to the board and not to players.
        Returns:
        the owner of the piece
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this piece type has no player and is owned by the board
        See Also:
        getPlayerNumber()

      • getPlayerNumber

                    throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Get the owner's player number.
        Returns:
        getPlayer().getPlayerNumber()
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this piece type has no player and is owned by the board
        Since:
        2.0.00

        public void setGameInfo(SOCPlayer pl,
                        SOCBoard b)

        Parameters:

        b - Board; not null

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Compare this SOCPlayingPiece to another SOCPlayingPiece, or another object. Comparison method:
        • If other is null, false.
        • If other is not a SOCPlayingPiece, use our super.equals to compare.
        • SOCPlayingPieces are equal if same piece type, coordinate, and player.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - The object to compare with, or null.
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • getResourcesToBuild

        public static SOCResourceSet getResourcesToBuild(int pieceType)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        the set of resources a player needs to build a playing piece.
        Parameters:
        pieceType - The type of this playing piece, in range MIN to (MAXPLUSONE - 1). ROAD, CITY, etc. For convenience, can also pass -2 or MAXPLUSONE for SOCDevCard.COST.
        Returns:
        the set, such as SOCSettlement.COST
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pieceType is out of range, or can never be built by players
        Since:
        1.1.08

      • getTypeName

        public static java.lang.String getTypeName(int pieceType)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get a piece type's unique technical name, which is similar to constant field names like CITY.
        Parameters:
        pieceType - A constant such as CITY
        Returns:
        Piece type's unique technical name, all-uppercase and following the pattern [A-Z][A-Z0-9_]+, or Integer.toString(pieceType) if not a recognized type constant
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pieceType < 0
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        getType(String)

      • getTypeName

        public static java.lang.String getTypeName(int typeNum,
                                           java.lang.String[] allTypeNames)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        For game items which have different type constants (SOCPlayingPiece, SOCDevCard, etc), get an item type's unique technical name for a constant value.
        Parameters:
        typeNum - A constant such as SOCDevCardConstants.UNIV or CITY
        allTypeNames - All known item types' unique technical names, indexed same as their int constant values. See return javadoc for expected name format. Null elements are ignored, in case your type has no constant at index 0 or some other index; if element 7 is null, will return "7" for it.
        Returns:
        That type constant's unique technical name, all-uppercase and following the pattern [A-Z][A-Z0-9_]+, or Integer.toString(typeNum) if typeNum not a recognized type constant from allTypeNames
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if typeNum < 0
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        getType(String, String[], int)

      • getType

        public static int getType(java.lang.String typeName)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Given a piece type's unique technical name like "CITY", return its piece type constant like CITY if recognized.
        Parameters:
        typeName - Piece type's technical name, as returned by getTypeName(int), or a numeric string like "42" for any recognized or unrecognized type's numeric value
        Returns:
        That type's constant such as CITY or SETTLEMENT if recognized, or its parsed value if starts with a digit, or -1 if type string is unrecognized
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if typeName is null or "", or doesn't start with an uppercase 'A'-'Z' or digit '0'-'9'
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if typeName starts with a digit but Integer.parseInt(String) fails
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        getTypeName(int)

      • getType

        public static int getType(java.lang.String typeName,
                          java.lang.String[] allTypeNames,
                          int unknownValue)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.NumberFormatException
        For game items which have different type constants (SOCPlayingPiece, SOCDevCard, etc), get an item type's constant value from its unique technical name returned by getType(String, String[],int).
        Parameters:
        typeName - Type's technical name, as returned by getTypeName(int, String[]), or a numeric string like "42" for any recognized or unrecognized type's numeric value
        allTypeNames - All known item types' unique technical names, indexed same as their int constant values. See getTypeName(int, String[]) javadoc for expected name format. Null elements are ignored, in case your type has no constant at index 0 or some other index.
        unknownValue - Value to return if typeName is unrecognized, because it isn't in allTypeNames
        Returns:
        That type's constant if typeName recognized from allTypeNames, or its parsed intValue if starts with a digit, or unknownValue if type string is unrecognized
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if typeName is null or "" or doesn't start with an uppercase 'A'-'Z' or digit '0'-'9', or if AllTypeNames is null
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if typeName starts with a digit but Integer.parseInt(String) fails
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        getTypeName(int, String[])
